Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2010 12:09PM barnest wrote: Im 29 and the best advice I can give you is the same advice that has been given to me and that is dont stop till you know 100% what these lumps are. If there is doubt in your mind it will drive you crazy. Trust me. The ladies on here give great advice and support. They will listen when it seems no one else will. Stay tuned you are sure to get some great advice here.
Posts.Title: I have 2 lumps mommy2x mommy2x

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 07:50AM barnest wrote: Hey mommy2x how was your appt with the surgeon?
Posts.Title: I have 2 lumps mommy2x mommy2x

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2010 10:56AM barnest wrote: Talk to the surgeon that is going to see you Friday about the itching. Make sure you go to your appt prepared with questions that you want answered. I didnt and I had so many questions after I left. Ladies our age tend to get blown off a bit so make sure that the doc understands all of your concerns.  Make sure that when all is said in done you know what is inside of you. I still dont know and I had a core needle biopsy.  So I will keep going til I know what it is.  They may try to tell you what it might be but just tell them you want to KNOW exactly what it is. Hopefully you will be seeing a surgion tha specializes in breast issues but if not just make sure the doc explains everything to you until you are 100% satisfied. There are more b9 lumps then malignant ones so with that and your age the odds of you NOT having cancer are in your favor. But, from experience, its best to KNOW what it is for sure.
Posts.Title: I have 2 lumps mommy2x mommy2x
